timeline.bodyText: Can we put in the order now? The ordering should be accurate, though if you're looking at the command outputs, they may not be ordered. What is guaranteed is the state transition order, not necessarily the command execution order.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: As a customer I don't want to go into finding the internal kernel logs. I should be testing only using what I expect from my applications. After adding listeners, I am not using timestamps in logs to verify this.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: My point was that I know you removed order checking because it was failing. I believe this may have occurred because of what I describe here, but that's only a guess since I don't know what you implemented or what errors you were seeing.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: handling? If we're not handling it we should be rethrowing it.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: This should be redone as part of package cache implementation.

Fixing Mosquitto recipe for ubuntu

timeline.bodyText: use hamcrest contain here to get a better error.

timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: The timestamp of the logs are not a consistent way of ensuring the order so I am removing this check for now.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: I misunderstood the error. This works.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: This will work, but we can let it go for now. My blocked PR will take care of it!
replies.author: leaf94

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't look like a real end-to-end test? Why not use DeploymentService?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: This is not end to end. It is integration test which is operating on component level testing. Deployment service calls the deployment task in an async notification handler. Invoking that handler will require mocking. And I was trying to avoid mocking in these tests. Writing end to end is a separate task and calling Deployment Servic should be covered there.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Why log twice? Also usually we don't log and throw to prevent duplicate messages. If the code already throws, we can assume the caller will handle it properly (which might include logging).
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Yes I agree. Removed it from here
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Add a log here
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: I guess cancellation is not handled here if there is a new deployment come in. Fine with it for now as long as we are aware of it.
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Right, cancellation needs to be handled and it will be done as part of future tasks. It is captured in backlog
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: I agree that trys should cover minimum statements. But in this case the suggested change won't work. I want to submit the deploymentTask only when it did not get exception. I don't like adding another null check.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: True. But I guess we can return after catching the exception, so that the happy path code only run without exception?

timeline.bodyText:
What's error if using @Inject?
Is it because that it doesn't work for LocalPacakgeStore(String path) since our DI right now only injects on type but not name? So String won't work... But Kernel for example works. I think PackageCache and KernelConfigResolver should work with @Inject, with my limited knowledge on this...
timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: Injecting these dependencies should remove a lot of boilerplate code, and besides there already is a constructor for DeploymentService that takes in these objects, why do we need these null checks and initialization code here still?
replies.author: shaguptashaikh
abanthiy

replies.bodyText:
I guess I'm still wondering what's the difference between KernelConfigResolver vs Kernel from the DI perspective.
But I do agree that we can revisit it later.

timeline.bodyText: remove the skipif as it's not necessary here. Same for other yaml files
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+---
+RecipeTemplateVersion: '2020-01-25'
+PackageName: Mosquitto
+Description: Mosquitto MQTT Server
+Publisher: Eclipse Foundation
+Version: '1.0.0'
+Lifecycle:
+  startup:
+    macos: echo "Hello this is mosquitto getting started"
+    ubuntu: echo "Hello this is mosquitto getting started"
+  install:
+    macos:
+      skipif: exists ~/

replies.bodyText: Added it because kernel code was throwing invalid config error (I am fixing that). This is still a valid config right?
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: Yes it's a valid config, just not necessary. Also this extra 'skipif' logic might cause test to pass/fail unexpectedly
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I am fine removing it. We will eventually need to add it to test skipif. But why would skipif cause unexpected behavior in this case?
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: if the test host has a '~/ ' then the command won't be run.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: and skipif shouldn't be tested in DA
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: try catch not needed here
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I prefer explicitly capturing what does not need to happen.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: as Mike commented: Don't catch and then fail, just let the method throw.
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: seems same as PackageManager. LOCAL_PACKAGE_SOURCE?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Yes. This PR is not intended to address how package cache is going to be used/implemented. So you can consider this as a temporary workaround. Package cache work will be done in this sprint and will have a separate PR for it.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: in this case, can we reach agreement on where to put this const string? If it belongs to package cache maybe move to PackageCache class
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: This is PackageCache class. PackageManager class is no longer being used. Right now DeploymentService is initializing this path as well. At this point I do not know whether there will be a PackageCache or not so I do not want to make these decisions right now as they should be made as part of separate task.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: seems same as PackageManager. LOCAL_PACKAGE_SOURCE?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Correct. From what I see, PackageManager class is no longer being used now. DeploymentService is currently initializing all the classes so this is needed.  PackageManager should be removed eventually

+---
+RecipeTemplateVersion: '2020-01-25'
+PackageName: TickTock
+Description: A *very* helpful periodic service
+Publisher: Me
+Version: '1.0.0'
+Parameters:
+  - name: Period
+    type: NUMBER
+    value: 2
+Lifecycle:
+  run:
+    "echo No tick-tocking with period: {{params:Period.value}}"

replies.bodyText: No, I specifically want to say that this package is not periodic. Updated the description message of the package as well.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: since this isn't actually periodic, no. But probably this should be made periodic, or have the name changed.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I have changed the name
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Should this also take the timestamp? If we're going to have an integration test to ensure the same job document when submitted twice is treated as a no-op but the deployment succeeds, it'll have the same timestamp both the times
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Yes it can be modified to take the timestamp.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: This parsing logic already exists in the DA, that should also be covered by the integ tests, right?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: The point from which this integration tests start the testing the DA code is after the parsing is done, thats why need to do it here. End to end should cover the parsing happening in service
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: This file is used for integ tests that will logically live forever now, so this file should be named something other than '*Demo' I think
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: True.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Redundant error logs?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Fixed
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Not sure what value these two methods which are pretty much the same are adding, they could just be replaced by one method if you take the status as a parameter. Also, when you call these you're always passing null for statusDetails, why is that?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: When I wrote them, I imagined the status details will be constructed in these methods. Even though now I am passing the status details map but the resetting of jobId is specific to these two states, it should not happen for IN_PROGRESS update. At this point I would like to keep them separate and I am open to refactor them later. I am currently passing status details as null for success update because there are no additional status details. Passing null at another failure point because we have not decided what needs to be sent in status details. It should be covered in future PRs.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Why is a default key value par for JobId being cleared while trying to update the job? should it be updated right after pulling the job from cloud and cleaned up when you're done processing the deployment?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: This is a final update for the job, so it works equally well. If any other logs show up after this job completion, and before the next job comes, the jobId will linger on.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Nit - why concatenate two string literals in the log here?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Was a debug log I was using for demo. Removed it. Long Line characters must have added the +
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: Now that you're adding a Setter on this to be able to change this from the tests, I noticed that all of these members are default, could you make them private?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

timeline.bodyText: There are constructors and a builder and a setter for the timestamp member, some of them have to be redundant
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText:
NoArgs is required by ObjectMapper. With builder if you want to use NoArgs then you have to add AllArgs. Issue is explained at - https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/project-lombok/xPgFBhWqhNA
I need setter only to set the timestamp after the Document is Deserialized in the test.
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText: We could also make these private
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: abanthiy

timeline.bodyText:
Why are you getting the cause of the InvalidRequestException?
Also, nitpick, combine these strings since they're on the same line anyway.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Because IRE can be encapsulating another Throwable as well. I have also added a message as a key value.
replies.author: abanthiy

replies.bodyText: I understand that, but that's why you should just do setCause(e). When saving the log it will give you the full cause-chain.
